title: Persik Kediri
text:
Persatuan Sepak Bola Indonesia Kediri, commonly known as Persik Kediri, is an Indonesian professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Kediri%20%28city%29">Kediri, East Java</a>. The club was founded in 1950 and currently competes in the <a href="Liga%201%20%28Indonesia%29">Liga 1</a>.
History.
The club was founded in 1950 by <a href="Raden%20Muchamad%20Machin">Raden Muchamad Machin</a>, <a href="T.H.D.%20Rahmat">T.H.D. Rahmat</a>, and <a href="M.%20Sanusi">M. Sanusi</a>. Since the <a href="Liga%20Indonesia">Liga Indonesia</a> started in 1994, Persik has won <a href="2003%20Liga%20Indonesia%20Premier%20Division">2003</a> and <a href="2006%20Liga%20Indonesia%20Premier%20Division">2006</a> editions respectively. The club promoted to the top-tier level in 2002. In the East Java, Persik Kediri has a great name, the team was famous football club also with <a href="Arema%20FC">Arema</a> Indonesia, <a href="Persebaya%20Surabaya">Persebaya</a>, which used to be the best derbies in East Java. The supporters of this club are called <a href="Persik%20Mania">Persik Mania</a> and <a href="Persik%20Nona">Persik Nona</a>.
